channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 内部メモ：欧州委員会は、偽情報への懸念と「風評被害」を避けるため、Xに関する「広告の一時停止」を計画している（Nicholas Vinocur/Politico）
item.description:
Nicholas Vinocur / Politico:
Internal note: the European Commission plans to “temporarily suspend advertising” on X over disinformation concerns and to avoid “reputational damage”  —  Ads on Musk-owned social media site risk causing ‘reputational damage’ to the EU, its executive says in internal note.

item.title: ヒップホップ・スターの裁判や苦難を取材し、ソーシャルメディア、特にブラック・ツイッターで人気を博した法律記者メーガン・クニフのプロフィール（Anne Branigin/Washington Post）
item.description:
Anne Branigin / Washington Post:
A profile of legal reporter Meghann Cuniff, who became popular via social media, particularly Black Twitter, for covering hip-hop stars' trials and tribulations  —  Covering the trials of hip-hop celebs made Meghann Cuniff a star on social media.  Now, she's translating legalese for the masses.

item.title: 情報源：ロサンゼルス・タイムズ紙は、イスラエルによるガザ空爆を非難する公開書簡に署名したスタッフに対し、少なくとも3ヶ月間は戦争の取材を禁止する（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Sources: the Los Angeles Times bans staff members who signed an open letter condemning Israel's bombing of Gaza from covering the war for at least three months  —  The Scoop  —  The Los Angeles Times is prohibiting staff from covering the Gaza war for at least three months if they signed …

item.title: メディア・マターズが、XがIBM、アップル、オラクル、Xfinity、NBCUのBravoの広告を親ナチスの広告と一緒に掲載していると指摘したため、IBMはXへの広告掲載を一時停止した（Hannah Murphy/Financial Times）。
item.description:
Hannah Murphy / Financial Times:
IBM suspends its advertising on X after Media Matters said X has been placing ads for IBM, Apple, Oracle, Xfinity, and NBCU's Bravo alongside pro-Nazi material  —  Tech company's move is the latest setback to Linda Yaccarino's efforts to convince brands Elon Musk's platform is safe

item.title: サムスンはTV Plusをアップデートし、専用の音楽配信、ベスト・オブ・キッズ・セクション、より多くのニュース報道を追加、アプリの世界視聴者数は前年比60％増と発表（Kayla Wassell/Cord Cutters News）
item.description:
Kayla Wassell / Cord Cutters News:
Samsung updates TV Plus with a dedicated music destination, a Best of Kids section, and more news coverage, and says the app's global viewership is up 60% YoY  —  Samsung TV Plus released a slew of new channels, titles, and an extensive product update to help find new content on the free platform.

item.title: YouTubeがガイドラインを更新、子どもがいる場合の授乳中のヌードや、性的でない生々しいダンスなどを表示する動画の収益化を認める（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
YouTube updates its guidelines to allow monetizing videos that display nudity while breastfeeding if a child is present, non-sexually graphic dancing, and more  —  YouTube is updating its guidelines to allow new types of content to monetize adult content, including videos that display nudity …

item.title: 10人以上のユダヤ系セレブやクリエイターがTikTokの幹部と電話で対立し、アプリ上での反ユダヤ主義やハラスメントにもっと対処するよう求めた（Sapna Maheshwari/New York Times）
item.description:
Sapna Maheshwari / New York Times:
Over a dozen Jewish celebrities and creators confronted TikTok executives on a call, urging them to do more to address antisemitism and harassment on the app  —  TikTok faces escalating accusations that it promotes pro-Palestinian, anti-Israel content.  “Shame on you,” Sacha Baron Cohen said on the call.

item.title: CBSラジオに対するオーダシーの約15億ドルの賭けはいかに裏目に出たか：ラジオは苦戦、ポッドキャストとストリーミング・オーディオは失われた広告売上を補うほどの収益を上げられなかった、など（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
How Audacy's ~$1.5B bet on CBS Radio backfired: radio is struggling, podcasts and streaming audio did not make enough revenue to replace lost ad sales, and more  —  - Field family gambled, lost on $1.5 billion CBS Radio merger  — Young listeners and sponsors bailing on struggling industry

item.title: TikTok、9.11同時多発テロを正当化したウサマ・ビン・ラディンの「アメリカへの手紙」を宣伝する動画を削除するも、トレンド入りしていたとの報道は「不正確」としている（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
TikTok removes videos promoting Osama Bin Laden's “Letter to America” that justified the 9/11 attacks, but calls reports that they were trending “inaccurate”  —  - George Santos “Blatantly Stole From His Campaign” And Deceived Donors, House Ethics Committee Report Says; Congressman Won't Seek Reelection

item.title: ネッド・ブラックホークが全米図書賞のノンフィクション部門を、ジャスティン・トーレスがフィクション部門を受賞、12人以上の候補者がイスラエルとハマスの停戦を求める声明を発表（Hillel Italie/Associated Press）
item.description:
Hillel Italie / Associated Press:
Ned Blackhawk wins the National Book Award for nonfiction and Justin Torres wins for fiction; 12+ nominees issue a statement seeking an Israel-Hamas cease-fire  —  Justin Torres' novel “Blackouts,” a daring and illustrated narrative that blends history and imagination in its recounting …

item.title: ピューリッツァー賞受賞作家のアン・ボイヤーがニューヨーク・タイムズ誌の詩の編集者を辞任、パレスチナ人の苦しみについての「グーリッシュな婉曲表現」を非難（Dan Sheehan/Literary Hub）
item.description:
Dan Sheehan / Literary Hub:
Pulitzer Prize-winning writer Anne Boyer resigns as The New York Times Magazine's poetry editor, calling out “ghoulish euphemisms” about Palestinians' suffering  —  It's been a hell of a 24 hours for writers demonstrating moral courage.  —  Last night at the National Book Awards …

item.title: ニューズクエストのヘンリー・フォール・ウォーカーCEOに、地方紙衰退への逆襲、ペイウォール、AI実験、購読、地方広告販売などについてインタビュー（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
An interview with Newsquest CEO Henry Faure Walker about bucking the regional press decline, paywalls, AI experiments, subscriptions, local ad sales, and more  —  Online paywalls, AI experiments and local ad sales all came up in the rare interview.  —  The chief executive …

item.title: ポッドキャスト会社プーシキン・インダストリーズのスタッフ10人がWGAイーストを通じて組合結成。
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
A group of 10 staff members at podcast company Pushkin Industries unionizes through the WGA East, and management voluntarily recognizes the proposed unit  —  The unionization effort comes amid a broader retrenchment in the podcasting market

item.title: 調査：アメリカには2005年の8,891紙から約6,000紙が残り、4,790紙が週刊で発行されている。
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Study: there are ~6,000 local newspapers left in the US, down from 8,891 in 2005; 4,790 publish weekly and 204 counties, or 6.4%, don't have a local news outlet  —  The decline of local newspapers accelerated so rapidly in 2023 that analysts now believe the U.S. will have lost one-third …

item.title: ワシントン・ポスト紙が銃乱射事件に関する極めて生々しいレポートを発表した理由、残忍さと惨状を示し、鈍感化を避ける狙い（Tom Jones/Poynter）
item.description:
Tom Jones / Poynter:
How The Washington Post decided to publish an extremely graphic report on mass shootings, aiming to show the brutality and devastation and avoid desensitization  —  ‘We just felt that there was a lack of understanding of what actually happens in these shootings,’ the Post's executive editor told Poynter.
